intro: Toddalia trichocarpa, commonly known as the Mexican flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has compound leaves with small, ovate leaflets and produces woody pods containing seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species in tropical and subtropical regions. The tree is also valued for its fast growth and ability to provide shade in urban landscapes.
